apiList.annotation.id: Gets the unique identifier, which is meant to be used for easier tracking of Annotation objects.
apiList.annotation.state: Gets the state of the annotation.

apiList.annotationCollection.items: Gets the loaded child items in this collection.
apiList.annotationCollection.getFirst(): Gets the first annotation in this collection. Throws an ItemNotFound error if this collection is empty.
apiList.annotationCollection.getFirstOrNullObjec: Gets the first annotation in this collection. If this collection is empty, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.

apiList.body.contentControls: Gets the collection of rich text content control objects in the body.
apiList.body.context: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.
apiList.body.endnotes: Gets the collection of endnotes in the body.
apiList.body.fields: Gets the collection of field objects in the body.
apiList.body.font: Gets the text format of the body. Use this to get and set font name, size, color and other properties.
apiList.body.footnotes: Gets the collection of footnotes in the body.
apiList.body.inlinePictures: Gets the collection of InlinePicture objects in the body. The collection doesn't include floating images.
apiList.body.lists: Gets the collection of list objects in the body.
apiList.body.paragraphs: Gets the collection of paragraph objects in the body.
apiList.body.parentBody: Gets the parent body of the body. For example, a table cell body's parent body could be a header. Throws an ItemNotFound error if there isn't a parent body.
apiList.body.parentBodyOrNullObject: Gets the parent body of the body. For example, a table cell body's parent body could be a header. If there isn't a parent body, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.body.parentContentControl: Gets the content control that contains the body. Throws an ItemNotFound error if there isn't a parent content control.
apiList.body.parentContentControlOrNullObject: Gets the content control that contains the body. If there isn't a parent content control, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.body.parentSection: Gets the parent section of the body. Throws an ItemNotFound error if there isn't a parent section.
apiList.body.parentSectionOrNullObject: Gets the parent section of the body. If there isn't a parent section, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.body.style: Specifies the style name for the body. Use this property for custom styles and localized style names. To use the built-in styles that are portable between locales, see the 'styleBuiltIn' property.
apiList.body.styleBuiltIn: Specifies the built-in style name for the body. Use this property for built-in styles that are portable between locales. To use custom styles or localized style names, see the 'style' property.
apiList.body.tables: Gets the collection of table objects in the body.
apiList.body.text: Gets the text of the body. Use the insertText method to insert text.
apiList.body.type: Gets the type of the body. The type can be 'MainDoc', 'Section', 'Header', 'Footer', or 'TableCell'. Additional types 'Footnote', 'Endnote', and 'NoteItem' are supported in WordAPIOnline 1.1 and later.
apiList.body.clear(): Clears the contents of the body object. The user can perform the undo operation on the cleared content.
apiList.body.getComments(): Gets comments associated with the body.
apiList.body.getContentControls(options): Gets the currently supported content controls in the body.
apiList.body.getHtml(): Gets an HTML representation of the body object. When rendered in a web page or HTML viewer, the formatting will be a close, but not exact, match for of the formatting of the document. This method doesn't return the exact same HTML for the same document on different platforms (Windows, Mac, Word on the web, etc.). If you need exact fidelity, or consistency across platforms, use Body.getOoxml() and convert the returned XML to HTML.
apiList.body.getOoxml(): Gets the OOXML (Office Open XML) representation of the body object.
apiList.body.getRange(rangeLocation): Gets the whole body, or the starting or ending point of the body, as a range.
apiList.body.getReviewedText(changeTrackingVersi: Gets reviewed text based on ChangeTrackingVersion selection.
Gets reviewed text based on ChangeTrackingVersion selection.
apiList.body.getTrackedChanges(): Gets the collection of the TrackedChange objects in the body.
apiList.body.insertBreak(breakType, insertLocati: Inserts a break at the specified location in the main document.
apiList.body.insertContentControl(contentControl: Wraps the Body object with a content control.
apiList.body.insertFileFromBase64(base64File, in: Inserts a document into the body at the specified location.
apiList.body.insertHtml(html, insertLocation): Inserts HTML at the specified location.
apiList.body.insertInlinePictureFromBase64(base6: Inserts a picture into the body at the specified location.
apiList.body.insertOoxml(ooxml, insertLocation): Inserts OOXML at the specified location.
apiList.body.insertParagraph(paragraphText, inse: Inserts a paragraph at the specified location.
apiList.body.insertTable(rowCount, columnCount,: Inserts a table with the specified number of rows and columns.
apiList.body.insertText(text, insertLocation): Inserts text into the body at the specified location.
apiList.body.load(options): Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.
apiList.body.load(propertyNames): Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

apiList.body.search(searchText, searchOptions): Performs a search with the specified SearchOptions on the scope of the body object. The search results are a collection of range objects.
apiList.body.select(selectionMode): Selects the body and navigates the Word UI to it.
apiList.body.select(selectionModeString): Selects the body and navigates the Word UI to it.
apiList.body.set(properties, options): Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.
apiList.body.set(properties): Sets multiple properties on the object at the same time, based on an existing loaded object.
apiList.body.onCommentAdded: Occurs when new comments are added.
apiList.body.onCommentChanged: Occurs when a comment or its reply is changed.
apiList.body.onCommentDeselected: Occurs when a comment is deselected.
apiList.body.onCommentSelected: Occurs when a comment is selected.

apiList.comment.id: Gets the ID of the comment.
apiList.comment.replies: Gets the collection of reply objects associated with the comment.
apiList.comment.resolved: Specifies the comment thread's status. Setting to true resolves the comment thread. Getting a value of true means that the comment thread is resolved.

apiList.comment.getRange(): Gets the range in the main document where the comment is on.

apiList.comment.set(properties): Sets multiple properties on the object at the same time, based on an existing loaded object.

apiList.contentControl.appearance: Specifies the appearance of the content control. The value can be 'BoundingBox', 'Tags', or 'Hidden'.
apiList.contentControl.cannotDelete: Specifies a value that indicates whether the user can delete the content control. Mutually exclusive with removeWhenEdited.
apiList.contentControl.cannotEdit: Specifies a value that indicates whether the user can edit the contents of the content control.
apiList.contentControl.checkboxContentControl: Specifies the checkbox-related data if the content control's type is 'CheckBox'. It's null otherwise.
apiList.contentControl.color: Specifies the color of the content control. Color is specified in '#RRGGBB' format or by using the color name.
apiList.contentControl.contentControls: Gets the collection of content control objects in the content control.
apiList.contentControl.context: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.
apiList.contentControl.endnotes: Gets the collection of endnotes in the content control.
apiList.contentControl.fields: Gets the collection of field objects in the content control.
apiList.contentControl.font: Gets the text format of the content control. Use this to get and set font name, size, color, and other properties.
apiList.contentControl.footnotes: Gets the collection of footnotes in the content control.
apiList.contentControl.id: Gets an integer that represents the content control identifier.
apiList.contentControl.inlinePictures: Gets the collection of InlinePicture objects in the content control. The collection doesn't include floating images.
apiList.contentControl.lists: Gets the collection of list objects in the content control.
apiList.contentControl.paragraphs: Gets the collection of paragraph objects in the content control.
apiList.contentControl.parentBody: Gets the parent body of the content control.
apiList.contentControl.parentContentControl: Gets the content control that contains the content control. Throws an ItemNotFound error if there isn't a parent content control.
apiList.contentControl.parentContentControlOrNul: Gets the content control that contains the content control. If there isn't a parent content control, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.contentControl.parentTable: Gets the table that contains the content control. Throws an ItemNotFound error if it isn't contained in a table.
apiList.contentControl.parentTableCell: Gets the table cell that contains the content control. Throws an ItemNotFound error if it isn't contained in a table cell.
apiList.contentControl.parentTableCellOrNullObje: Gets the table cell that contains the content control. If it isn't contained in a table cell, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.contentControl.parentTableOrNullObject: Gets the table that contains the content control. If it isn't contained in a table, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.contentControl.placeholderText: Specifies the placeholder text of the content control. Dimmed text will be displayed when the content control is empty. Note: The set operation for this property isn't supported in Word on the web.
apiList.contentControl.removeWhenEdited: Specifies a value that indicates whether the content control is removed after it is edited. Mutually exclusive with cannotDelete.
apiList.contentControl.style: Specifies the style name for the content control. Use this property for custom styles and localized style names. To use the built-in styles that are portable between locales, see the 'styleBuiltIn' property.
apiList.contentControl.styleBuiltIn: Specifies the built-in style name for the content control. Use this property for built-in styles that are portable between locales. To use custom styles or localized style names, see the 'style' property.
apiList.contentControl.subtype: Gets the content control subtype. The subtype can be 'RichTextInline', 'RichTextParagraphs', 'RichTextTableCell', 'RichTextTableRow' and 'RichTextTable' for rich text content controls, or 'PlainTextInline' and 'PlainTextParagraph' for plain text content controls, or 'CheckBox' for checkbox content controls.
apiList.contentControl.tables: Gets the collection of table objects in the content control.
apiList.contentControl.tag: Specifies a tag to identify a content control.
apiList.contentControl.text: Gets the text of the content control.
apiList.contentControl.title: Specifies the title for a content control.
apiList.contentControl.type: Gets the content control type. Only rich text, plain text, and checkbox content controls are supported currently.
apiList.contentControl.clear(): Clears the contents of the content control. The user can perform the undo operation on the cleared content.
apiList.contentControl.delete(keepContent): Deletes the content control and its content. If keepContent is set to true, the content isn't deleted.
apiList.contentControl.getComments(): Gets comments associated with the content control.
apiList.contentControl.getContentControls(option: Gets the currently supported child content controls in this content control.
apiList.contentControl.getHtml(): Gets an HTML representation of the content control object. When rendered in a web page or HTML viewer, the formatting will be a close, but not exact, match for of the formatting of the document. This method doesn't return the exact same HTML for the same document on different platforms (Windows, Mac, Word on the web, etc.). If you need exact fidelity, or consistency across platforms, use ContentControl.getOoxml() and convert the returned XML to HTML.
apiList.contentControl.getOoxml(): Gets the Office Open XML (OOXML) representation of the content control object.
apiList.contentControl.getRange(rangeLocation): Gets the whole content control, or the starting or ending point of the content control, as a range.
apiList.contentControl.getReviewedText(changeTra: Gets reviewed text based on ChangeTrackingVersion selection.
Gets reviewed text based on ChangeTrackingVersion selection.
apiList.contentControl.getTextRanges(endingMarks: Gets the text ranges in the content control by using punctuation marks and/or other ending marks.
apiList.contentControl.getTrackedChanges(): Gets the collection of the TrackedChange objects in the content control.

apiList.contentControl.insertText(text, insertLo: Inserts text into the content control at the specified location.

apiList.contentControlOptions.types: An array of content control types, item must be 'RichText', 'PlainText', or 'CheckBox'.

apiList.document.body: Gets the body object of the main document. The body is the text that excludes headers, footers, footnotes, textboxes, etc.
apiList.document.contentControls: Gets the collection of content control objects in the document. This includes content controls in the body of the document, headers, footers, textboxes, etc.
apiList.document.context: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.
apiList.document.customXmlParts: Gets the custom XML parts in the document.
apiList.document.properties: Gets the properties of the document.
apiList.document.saved: Indicates whether the changes in the document have been saved. A value of true indicates that the document hasn't changed since it was saved.
apiList.document.sections: Gets the collection of section objects in the document.
apiList.document.settings: Gets the add-in's settings in the document.
apiList.document.addStyle(name, type): Adds a style into the document by name and type.
apiList.document.addStyle(name, typeString): Adds a style into the document by name and type.
apiList.document.compare(filePath, documentCompa: Displays revision marks that indicate where the specified document differs from another document.
apiList.document.deleteBookmark(name): Deletes a bookmark, if it exists, from the document.
apiList.document.getAnnotationById(id): Gets the annotation by ID. Throws an ItemNotFound error if annotation isn't found.
apiList.document.getBookmarkRange(name): Gets a bookmark's range. Throws an ItemNotFound error if the bookmark doesn't exist.

apiList.document.getContentControls(options): Gets the currently supported content controls in the document.
apiList.document.getEndnoteBody(): Gets the document's endnotes in a single body.
apiList.document.getFootnoteBody(): Gets the document's footnotes in a single body.
apiList.document.getParagraphByUniqueLocalId(id): Gets the paragraph by its unique local ID. Throws an ItemNotFound error if the collection is empty.
apiList.document.getSelection(): Gets the current selection of the document. Multiple selections aren't supported.
apiList.document.getStyles(): Gets a StyleCollection object that represents the whole style set of the document.
apiList.document.importStylesFromJson(stylesJson: Import styles from a JSON-formatted string.

apiList.documentCreated.load(options): Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.
apiList.documentCreated.load(propertyNames): Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.
apiList.documentCreated.load(propertyNamesAndPat: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.
apiList.documentCreated.set(properties, options): Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.
apiList.documentCreated.set(properties): Sets multiple properties on the object at the same time, based on an existing loaded object.

apiList.paragraph.alignment: Specifies the alignment for a paragraph. The value can be 'left', 'centered', 'right', or 'justified'.
apiList.paragraph.contentControls: Gets the collection of content control objects in the paragraph.
apiList.paragraph.context: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.
apiList.paragraph.endnotes: Gets the collection of endnotes in the paragraph.
apiList.paragraph.fields: Gets the collection of fields in the paragraph.
apiList.paragraph.firstLineIndent: Specifies the value, in points, for a first line or hanging indent. Use a positive value to set a first-line indent, and use a negative value to set a hanging indent.
apiList.paragraph.font: Gets the text format of the paragraph. Use this to get and set font name, size, color, and other properties.
apiList.paragraph.footnotes: Gets the collection of footnotes in the paragraph.
apiList.paragraph.inlinePictures: Gets the collection of InlinePicture objects in the paragraph. The collection doesn't include floating images.
apiList.paragraph.isLastParagraph: Indicates the paragraph is the last one inside its parent body.
apiList.paragraph.isListItem: Checks whether the paragraph is a list item.
apiList.paragraph.leftIndent: Specifies the left indent value, in points, for the paragraph.
apiList.paragraph.lineSpacing: Specifies the line spacing, in points, for the specified paragraph. In the Word UI, this value is divided by 12.
apiList.paragraph.lineUnitAfter: Specifies the amount of spacing, in grid lines, after the paragraph.
apiList.paragraph.lineUnitBefore: Specifies the amount of spacing, in grid lines, before the paragraph.
apiList.paragraph.list: Gets the List to which this paragraph belongs. Throws an ItemNotFound error if the paragraph isn't in a list.
apiList.paragraph.listItem: Gets the ListItem for the paragraph. Throws an ItemNotFound error if the paragraph isn't part of a list.
apiList.paragraph.listItemOrNullObject: Gets the ListItem for the paragraph. If the paragraph isn't part of a list, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.paragraph.listOrNullObject: Gets the List to which this paragraph belongs. If the paragraph isn't in a list, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.paragraph.outlineLevel: Specifies the outline level for the paragraph.
apiList.paragraph.parentBody: Gets the parent body of the paragraph.
apiList.paragraph.parentContentControl: Gets the content control that contains the paragraph. Throws an ItemNotFound error if there isn't a parent content control.
apiList.paragraph.parentContentControlOrNullObje: Gets the content control that contains the paragraph. If there isn't a parent content control, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.paragraph.parentTable: Gets the table that contains the paragraph. Throws an ItemNotFound error if it isn't contained in a table.
apiList.paragraph.parentTableCell: Gets the table cell that contains the paragraph. Throws an ItemNotFound error if it isn't contained in a table cell.
apiList.paragraph.parentTableCellOrNullObject: Gets the table cell that contains the paragraph. If it isn't contained in a table cell, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.paragraph.parentTableOrNullObject: Gets the table that contains the paragraph. If it isn't contained in a table, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.paragraph.rightIndent: Specifies the right indent value, in points, for the paragraph.
apiList.paragraph.spaceAfter: Specifies the spacing, in points, after the paragraph.
apiList.paragraph.spaceBefore: Specifies the spacing, in points, before the paragraph.
apiList.paragraph.style: Specifies the style name for the paragraph. Use this property for custom styles and localized style names. To use the built-in styles that are portable between locales, see the 'styleBuiltIn' property.
apiList.paragraph.styleBuiltIn: Specifies the built-in style name for the paragraph. Use this property for built-in styles that are portable between locales. To use custom styles or localized style names, see the 'style' property.
apiList.paragraph.tableNestingLevel: Gets the level of the paragraph's table. It returns 0 if the paragraph isn't in a table.
apiList.paragraph.text: Gets the text of the paragraph.
apiList.paragraph.uniqueLocalId: Gets a string that represents the paragraph identifier in the current session. ID is in standard 8-4-4-4-12 GUID format without curly braces and differs across sessions and coauthors.
apiList.paragraph.attachToList(listId, level): Lets the paragraph join an existing list at the specified level. Fails if the paragraph cannot join the list or if the paragraph is already a list item.
apiList.paragraph.clear(): Clears the contents of the paragraph object. The user can perform the undo operation on the cleared content.
apiList.paragraph.delete(): Deletes the paragraph and its content from the document.
apiList.paragraph.detachFromList(): Moves this paragraph out of its list, if the paragraph is a list item.
apiList.paragraph.getAnnotations(): Gets annotations set on this Paragraph object.
apiList.paragraph.getComments(): Gets comments associated with the paragraph.
apiList.paragraph.getContentControls(options): Gets the currently supported content controls in the paragraph.
apiList.paragraph.getHtml(): Gets an HTML representation of the paragraph object. When rendered in a web page or HTML viewer, the formatting will be a close, but not exact, match for of the formatting of the document. This method doesn't return the exact same HTML for the same document on different platforms (Windows, Mac, Word on the web, etc.). If you need exact fidelity, or consistency across platforms, use Paragraph.getOoxml() and convert the returned XML to HTML.
apiList.paragraph.getNext(): Gets the next paragraph. Throws an ItemNotFound error if the paragraph is the last one.
apiList.paragraph.getNextOrNullObject(): Gets the next paragraph. If the paragraph is the last one, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.paragraph.getOoxml(): Gets the Office Open XML (OOXML) representation of the paragraph object.
apiList.paragraph.getPrevious(): Gets the previous paragraph. Throws an ItemNotFound error if the paragraph is the first one.
apiList.paragraph.getPreviousOrNullObject(): Gets the previous paragraph. If the paragraph is the first one, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.paragraph.getRange(rangeLocation): Gets the whole paragraph, or the starting or ending point of the paragraph, as a range.
apiList.paragraph.getReviewedText(changeTracking: Gets reviewed text based on ChangeTrackingVersion selection.
Gets reviewed text based on ChangeTrackingVersion selection.
apiList.paragraph.getText(options): Returns the text of the paragraph. This excludes equations, graphics (e.g., images, videos, drawings), and special characters that mark various content (e.g., for content controls, fields, comments, footnotes, endnotes). By default, hidden text and text marked as deleted are excluded.
apiList.paragraph.getTextRanges(endingMarks, tri: Gets the text ranges in the paragraph by using punctuation marks and/or other ending marks.
apiList.paragraph.getTrackedChanges(): Gets the collection of the TrackedChange objects in the paragraph.
apiList.paragraph.insertAnnotations(annotations): Inserts annotations on this Paragraph object.
apiList.paragraph.insertBreak(breakType, insertL: Inserts a break at the specified location in the main document.
apiList.paragraph.insertContentControl(contentCo: Wraps the Paragraph object with a content control.
apiList.paragraph.insertFileFromBase64(base64Fil: Inserts a document into the paragraph at the specified location.
apiList.paragraph.insertHtml(html, insertLocatio: Inserts HTML into the paragraph at the specified location.
apiList.paragraph.insertInlinePictureFromBase64(: Inserts a picture into the paragraph at the specified location.
apiList.paragraph.insertOoxml(ooxml, insertLocat: Inserts OOXML into the paragraph at the specified location.
apiList.paragraph.insertParagraph(paragraphText,: Inserts a paragraph at the specified location.
apiList.paragraph.insertTable(rowCount, columnCo: Inserts a table with the specified number of rows and columns.
apiList.paragraph.insertText(text, insertLocatio: Inserts text into the paragraph at the specified location.
apiList.paragraph.load(options): Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.
apiList.paragraph.load(propertyNames): Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.
apiList.paragraph.load(propertyNamesAndPaths): Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.
apiList.paragraph.search(searchText, searchOptio: Performs a search with the specified SearchOptions on the scope of the paragraph object. The search results are a collection of range objects.
apiList.paragraph.select(selectionMode): Selects and navigates the Word UI to the paragraph.
apiList.paragraph.select(selectionModeString): Selects and navigates the Word UI to the paragraph.
apiList.paragraph.set(properties, options): Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.
apiList.paragraph.set(properties): Sets multiple properties on the object at the same time, based on an existing loaded object.
apiList.paragraph.split(delimiters, trimDelimite: Splits the paragraph into child ranges by using delimiters.
apiList.paragraph.startNewList(): Starts a new list with this paragraph. Fails if the paragraph is already a list item.

apiList.paragraphCollection.context: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.
apiList.paragraphCollection.items: Gets the loaded child items in this collection.
apiList.paragraphCollection.getFirst(): Gets the first paragraph in this collection. Throws an ItemNotFound error if the collection is empty.
apiList.paragraphCollection.getFirstOrNullObject: Gets the first paragraph in this collection. If the collection is empty, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.paragraphCollection.getLast(): Gets the last paragraph in this collection. Throws an ItemNotFound error if the collection is empty.
apiList.paragraphCollection.getLastOrNullObject(: Gets the last paragraph in this collection. If the collection is empty, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.paragraphCollection.load(options): Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.
apiList.paragraphCollection.load(propertyNames): Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.
apiList.paragraphCollection.load(propertyNamesAn: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

apiList.range.contentControls: Gets the collection of content control objects in the range.
apiList.range.context: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.
apiList.range.endnotes: Gets the collection of endnotes in the range.
apiList.range.fields: Gets the collection of field objects in the range.
apiList.range.font: Gets the text format of the range. Use this to get and set font name, size, color, and other properties.
apiList.range.footnotes: Gets the collection of footnotes in the range.
apiList.range.hyperlink: Gets the first hyperlink in the range, or sets a hyperlink on the range. All hyperlinks in the range are deleted when you set a new hyperlink on the range. Use a '#' to separate the address part from the optional location part.
apiList.range.inlinePictures: Gets the collection of inline picture objects in the range.
apiList.range.isEmpty: Checks whether the range length is zero.
apiList.range.lists: Gets the collection of list objects in the range.
apiList.range.paragraphs: Gets the collection of paragraph objects in the range.
apiList.range.parentBody: Gets the parent body of the range.
apiList.range.parentContentControl: Gets the currently supported content control that contains the range. Throws an ItemNotFound error if there isn't a parent content control.
apiList.range.parentContentControlOrNullObject: Gets the currently supported content control that contains the range. If there isn't a parent content control, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.range.parentTable: Gets the table that contains the range. Throws an ItemNotFound error if it isn't contained in a table.
apiList.range.parentTableCell: Gets the table cell that contains the range. Throws an ItemNotFound error if it isn't contained in a table cell.
apiList.range.parentTableCellOrNullObject: Gets the table cell that contains the range. If it isn't contained in a table cell, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.range.parentTableOrNullObject: Gets the table that contains the range. If it isn't contained in a table, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.range.style: Specifies the style name for the range. Use this property for custom styles and localized style names. To use the built-in styles that are portable between locales, see the 'styleBuiltIn' property.
apiList.range.styleBuiltIn: Specifies the built-in style name for the range. Use this property for built-in styles that are portable between locales. To use custom styles or localized style names, see the 'style' property.
apiList.range.tables: Gets the collection of table objects in the range.
apiList.range.text: Gets the text of the range.
apiList.range.clear(): Clears the contents of the range object. The user can perform the undo operation on the cleared content.
apiList.range.compareLocationWith(range): Compares this range's location with another range's location.
apiList.range.delete(): Deletes the range and its content from the document.
apiList.range.expandTo(range): Returns a new range that extends from this range in either direction to cover another range. This range isn't changed. Throws an ItemNotFound error if the two ranges do not have a union.
apiList.range.expandToOrNullObject(range): Returns a new range that extends from this range in either direction to cover another range. This range isn't changed. If the two ranges don't have a union, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.range.getBookmarks(includeHidden, includ: Gets the names all bookmarks in or overlapping the range. A bookmark is hidden if its name starts with the underscore character.
apiList.range.getComments(): Gets comments associated with the range.
apiList.range.getContentControls(options): Gets the currently supported content controls in the range.
apiList.range.getHtml(): Gets an HTML representation of the range object. When rendered in a web page or HTML viewer, the formatting will be a close, but not exact, match for of the formatting of the document. This method doesn't return the exact same HTML for the same document on different platforms (Windows, Mac, Word on the web, etc.). If you need exact fidelity, or consistency across platforms, use Range.getOoxml() and convert the returned XML to HTML.
apiList.range.getHyperlinkRanges(): Gets hyperlink child ranges within the range.
apiList.range.getNextTextRange(endingMarks, trim: Gets the next text range by using punctuation marks and/or other ending marks. Throws an ItemNotFound error if this text range is the last one.
apiList.range.getNextTextRangeOrNullObject(endin: Gets the next text range by using punctuation marks and/or other ending marks. If this text range is the last one, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.range.getOoxml(): Gets the OOXML representation of the range object.
apiList.range.getRange(rangeLocation): Clones the range, or gets the starting or ending point of the range as a new range.
apiList.range.getReviewedText(changeTrackingVers: Gets reviewed text based on ChangeTrackingVersion selection.
Gets reviewed text based on ChangeTrackingVersion selection.
apiList.range.getTextRanges(endingMarks, trimSpa: Gets the text child ranges in the range by using punctuation marks and/or other ending marks.
apiList.range.getTrackedChanges(): Gets the collection of the TrackedChange objects in the range.
apiList.range.highlight(): Highlights the range temporarily without changing document content. To highlight the text permanently, set the range's Font.HighlightColor.
apiList.range.insertBookmark(name): Inserts a bookmark on the range. If a bookmark of the same name exists somewhere, it is deleted first.
apiList.range.insertBreak(breakType, insertLocat: Inserts a break at the specified location in the main document.
apiList.range.insertComment(commentText): Insert a comment on the range.
apiList.range.insertContentControl(contentContro: Wraps the Range object with a content control.
apiList.range.insertEndnote(insertText): Inserts an endnote. The endnote reference is placed after the range.
apiList.range.insertField(insertLocation, fieldT: Inserts a field at the specified location.
Inserts a field at the specified location.
apiList.range.insertFileFromBase64(base64File, i: Inserts a document at the specified location.
apiList.range.insertFootnote(insertText): Inserts a footnote. The footnote reference is placed after the range.
apiList.range.insertHtml(html, insertLocation): Inserts HTML at the specified location.
apiList.range.insertInlinePictureFromBase64(base: Inserts a picture at the specified location.
apiList.range.insertOoxml(ooxml, insertLocation): Inserts OOXML at the specified location.
apiList.range.insertParagraph(paragraphText, ins: Inserts a paragraph at the specified location.
apiList.range.insertTable(rowCount, columnCount,: Inserts a table with the specified number of rows and columns.
apiList.range.insertText(text, insertLocation): Inserts text at the specified location.
apiList.range.intersectWith(range): Returns a new range as the intersection of this range with another range. This range isn't changed. Throws an ItemNotFound error if the two ranges aren't overlapped or adjacent.
apiList.range.intersectWithOrNullObject(range): Returns a new range as the intersection of this range with another range. This range isn't changed. If the two ranges aren't overlapped or adjacent, then this method will return an object with its isNullObject property set to true. For further information, see *OrNullObject methods and properties.
apiList.range.load(options): Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.
apiList.range.load(propertyNames): Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.
apiList.range.load(propertyNamesAndPaths): Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.
apiList.range.removeHighlight(): Removes the highlight added by the Highlight function if any.
apiList.range.search(searchText, searchOptions): Performs a search with the specified SearchOptions on the scope of the range object. The search results are a collection of range objects.
apiList.range.select(selectionMode): Selects and navigates the Word UI to the range.
apiList.range.select(selectionModeString): Selects and navigates the Word UI to the range.
apiList.range.set(properties, options): Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.
apiList.range.set(properties): Sets multiple properties on the object at the same time, based on an existing loaded object.
apiList.range.split(delimiters, multiParagraphs,: Splits the range into child ranges by using delimiters.
